# Repository Insights Configuration

This document outlines the configuration for repository insights and analytics.

## GitHub Insights

### Pulse
- Regularly review pulse to monitor community activity
- Track pull request and issue activity
- Monitor commit frequency and contributor engagement

### Traffic
- Monitor repository traffic and popular content
- Track referral sources and popular paths
- Analyze content popularity and user engagement

### Commits
- Track commit frequency and patterns
- Monitor contributor activity over time
- Identify peak contribution periods

### Code Frequency
- Monitor lines of code added and removed
- Track codebase growth and refactoring efforts
- Identify modules with high change frequency

## Code Quality Metrics

### SonarQube Integration
- Set up SonarQube for code quality analysis
- Monitor code coverage, duplication, and complexity
- Track technical debt and maintainability
- Set quality gates for pull requests

### Code Coverage
- Maintain minimum code coverage threshold (80%)
- Track coverage trends over time
- Identify modules with low test coverage
- Require tests for new features

## Performance Monitoring

### CI/CD Metrics
- Track build success rates and durations
- Monitor deployment frequency and lead time
- Measure mean time to recovery (MTTR)
- Track change fail rate

### Frontend Performance
- Monitor page load times
- Track bundle sizes
- Measure Core Web Vitals
- Identify performance bottlenecks

## Contributor Analytics

### Community Growth
- Track contributor growth over time
- Monitor first-time contributor engagement
- Identify active and inactive contributors
- Measure contributor retention

### Issue Resolution
- Track issue response times
- Monitor issue resolution rates
- Measure time to first response
- Analyze issue categories and trends

## Reporting

### Regular Reports
- Generate weekly/monthly repository health reports
- Include key metrics and trends
- Highlight areas for improvement
- Share reports with the team

### Dashboards
- Create dashboards for real-time monitoring
- Display key metrics and KPIs
- Set up alerts for metric thresholds
- Provide access to relevant stakeholders
